attributes.action: Mandate a (Less Scroll) More Soul Bank Holiday: An annual offline day
attributes.additional_details:
We are an addicted nation. An 18 yr old will spend 25 yrs of their life on a phone. Children spend less time outdoors (<1hr) than inmates. Loneliness, anxiety and polarisation are spiraling and all this before consideration of specific harms: exploitation, radicalisation, misinformation+

The UK has fewer bank holidays than almost anywhere in Europe.
One offline day/ year could provide a critical reset and reminder of what’s important. A day to reconnect with ourselves and our local communities.
attributes.background: Britain needs a breather. An annual reset for our overwhelmed lives. A day where the nation logs off, looks up and reconnects. A government-enforced opportunity to not only build awareness for the grip tech has on us but remind us of what matters in a healthy society:  people, place and presence.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/726031
